issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
itemclick will fire when not in editing mode for listView. As soon as editing mode is enabled event listener ignores clicks.

allowsSelectionDuringEditing: true ... does not help to alleviate the issue
fields.summary: itemclick event listener does not fire in editing mode

comments.body:
itemclick won't fire in editing mode.

alternatively you can use the event callback in a template, but for some strange reason, some rows won't fire the listener. when I re-run simulator it is a different set of rows that won't fire. usually there are two rows that won't fire click event. i'm using sections.
Please provide a simple and complete test case to reproduce this issue and we would be happy to take a look.
Resolving this ticket as we cannot reproduce it and reporter has not followed up on the requested information.
